term.name: universalism
term.source: From Latin universalis: relating to all or to everything.
term.def: The view (opposed to &individualism;) that the proper goal of life is the welfare of all human beings; a specific form of &altruism;.

The view (opposed to &situationalism;) that principles applying to all situations should be weighted more heavily in ethical decision-making than the particulars of time or place; &deontologism; is one form of universalism.
